meanings.definition: In a sad or miserable manner.
meanings.sent1: She looked unhappily at the broken toy.
meanings.sent2: The puppy whined unhappily when left alone.
meanings.sent3: The clown unhappily juggled invisible balls.
meanings.sent4: The clouds hung unhappily in the sky, foretelling a storm.
meanings.sent5: The old man's face was etched unhappily with wrinkles.

meanings.sent1: He unhappily missed the last train home.
meanings.sent2: They unhappily realized they had forgotten the keys inside.
meanings.sent3: The cake unhappily fell on the floor before the party.
meanings.sent4: The news of the accident spread unhappily through the small town.
meanings.sent5: The sun set unhappily behind the dark clouds, ending the picnic early.
